casebody.data:
[Hillsborough,

June, 1890.] Metropolitan Life Ins. Co. v. Helmer. . Assumpsit, to recover moneys collected by the defendant as the plaintiffs’ agent. The court stated the accounts between the parties, finding $47.75 due to the defendant, and ordered judgment in his favor for that sum with interest from the date of the writ, subject to the plaintiffs’ exception. Burnham Brown, for the plaintiffs.. Sulloway & Topliff, for the defendant. Carpenter, J.

No error of law is pointed out by the plaintiffs.

Exceptions overruled.

Smith, J., did not sit: the others concurred.
